panels.anomaly: White door standing impossibly in middle of sidewalk

panels.door_details: White surface, golden knob, luminous quality

panels.background: Modern city fading to mythic space

dialogue.action: standing in front of a white door in the middle of the street
dialogue.context: crowd doesn't see it, only him
dialogue.text: That's not a door. That's an invitation. That's threshold imagery. Old as myth, old as death, old as the first human who stared into fire and thought, "Something's behind this."

psychological_notes: The door appearing only to the architect represents selective perception - we see the thresholds we're ready to cross. The mythic references connect personal transformation to universal human experiences of transition. The crowd's blindness shows how threshold moments are intensely personal.
philosophical_underpinning: Personal transformation follows ancient patterns that transcend individual experience
therapeutic_direction: Recognizing when life presents us with threshold moments
